lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A.’s committee on women in sports will review its guidelines amid reports of female athletes being threatened with the loss of scholarships if they became pregnant. Janet Kittell, the leader of the N.C.A.A.’s committee on women’s athletics, said that her group would review the rules on pregnancy in July.Last week, Cassandra Harding, a member of the Memphis track team, told The Associated Press that she lost her scholarship after becoming pregnant, and a Clemson athlete told ESPN that she had an abortion to stay in college.
